channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: Coronavirus: Beijing outbreak ramps up pressure on China’s economic momentum
item.description: Beijing’s rush to contain an outbreak in the capital with mass testing and tough restrictions is putting further strain on China’s economic growth momentum, with the city largely quiet over the five-day Labour Day holiday.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Lee
item.author: Amanda Lee

item.title: Sri Lanka opposition declares no confidence in government, seeks to oust PM
item.description: The motion blames Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and his cabinet for failing to provide decent living standards amid a deep economic crisis.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Ukraine war: US agenda for UN Security Council includes digital technology and isolating Russia
item.description: Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield discusses the priorities for Washington as it assumes the council leadership for a month and pressure builds to limit the war and its collateral damage.
item.dc:creator: Mark Magnier
item.author: Mark Magnier

item.title: Japan must change sexist work culture to reach its ‘womenomics’ goals, advocate says
item.description: Encouraging flexible work hours and start-ups with ‘more diverse founders’ will help more women get full-time jobs, says top executive Kathy Matsui.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Ukraine love story: nurse who lost legs in war has wedding dance with husband
item.description: Oksana Balandina, who stepped on a landmine on her way home, married sweetheart Viktor Vasyliv in a hospital ward in a romance closely followed by her countrymen.
item.dc:creator: Tribune News Service
item.author: Tribune News Service

item.title: US says Russia wrongfully detained basketball star Brittney Griner, hands case to hostage envoy
item.description: The shift means the US will now work more aggressively to secure the release of WNBA star Brittney Griner, who has already been held for 75 days.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Why the China-Solomon Islands pact is making waves in the Pacific
item.description: If Chinese security cooperation and economic largesse bring stability and prosperity to the islands, the message will resonate across the Pacific. However, the strong reaction of the region’s traditional powers could have a chilling effect on other countries eyeing a deal with China.
item.dc:creator: Lucio Blanco Pitlo III
item.author: Lucio Blanco Pitlo III

item.title: China wary of Russia-type sanctions, but Beijing’s ‘financial nuclear bombs’ are a powerful deterrent
item.description: Economy-crippling sanctions levied against Moscow serve as a ‘textbook warning for China’, but its prominent position in the global supply chain could hinder any US-led efforts to punish Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Ji Siqi
item.author: Ji Siqi

item.title: Ukraine war: 101 evacuees from Mariupol steel plant reach safety; Putin says Russia ready for talks with Ukraine
item.description: The UN says 101 civilians have been ‘successfully evacuated’ from Ukraine’s besieged and battered port city of Mariupol in a joint effort with the Red Cross.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,Associated Press
item.author: Reuters,Associated Press

item.title: Trade war: US looking at lifting tariffs on Chinese goods, American officials say
item.description: Office of US Trade Representative announces a required procedure, four years after the first tariffs were imposed by then-president Donald Trump; businesses that want the tariffs to continue are told to notify the office.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Fromer
item.author: Jacob Fromer

item.title: Biden says he will protect ‘fundamental’ right to abortion after leaked Supreme Court draft appearing to overturn Roe v. Wade
item.description: Biden said he’d seek to enshrine the protections of Roe v. Wade into US law, following a report the Supreme Court is poised to overturn the landmark ruling.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: Sunken Japanese tour boat searched with camera, 12 people still missing
item.description: 14 people were killed when the Kazu I went missing on April 23 after leaving port in Hokkaido despite a bad weather warning.
item.dc:creator: Kyodo
item.author: Kyodo

item.title: Hong Kong plunges to 148th in world press freedom rankings, according to annual index by Reporters Without Borders
item.description: Meanwhile, Arizona State University’s journalism school says it will take over the Foreign Correspondents’ Club’s annual human rights media awards.
item.dc:creator: Chris Lau
item.author: Chris Lau

item.title: China reports first fatalities from Changsha building collapse
item.description: Two people died after the structure caved in four days ago, officials say.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: India heatwave sparks blackouts, questions on coal usage
item.description: Supplies of coal at many power plants are running low, spawning daily power outages in several states, sparking scrutiny of India’s long reliance on coal, which produces 70 per cent of the country’s electricity.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Chinese aircraft carrier leads large strike group into western Pacific as Taiwan tensions rise
item.description: The Liaoning escorted on ‘routine mission’ by seven warships, including the PLA Navy’s most powerful destroyer.
item.dc:creator: Liu Zhen
item.author: Liu Zhen

item.title: Boris Johnson quotes Churchill hails Ukraine’s ‘finest hour’, promises more military aid to fight Russia invasion
item.description: Johnson pledged US$376 in military aid during a remote address to the Ukraine parliament, the first by a foreign leader to since Russia invaded on February 24.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hong Kong tycoon Jimmy Lai illegally ran consultancy firm at Apple Daily’s offices for more than 20 years, prosecutors say
item.description: Lai and former employee Wong Wai-keung accused of illegally subleasing Apple Daily’s office space to Dico Consultants Limited in 1998.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: Hong Kong police investigate death of decoration firm director after body discovered at store
item.description: Force spokesman says body of 58-year-old man discovered in his own store with ‘10cm cut wound to the neck’.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo,Christy Leung
item.author: Clifford Lo,Christy Leung

item.title: Taliban tells driving schools in Afghanistan to put the brakes on giving licenses to women drivers
item.description: Since returning to power, the Taliban have been restricting the rights of female Afghans, preventing them from returning to schools and many government jobs.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Mystery liver disease kills three children in Indonesia
item.description: Indonesia’s Health Ministry said in a statement the children died in hospitals last month, after displaying symptoms of nausea, vomiting, and diarrhoea.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Chinese economists censored, removed from social media after critical takes on zero-Covid policy
item.description: Online influencers with millions of followers are running afoul of Beijing’s censors by questioning the nation’s controversial strategy to stop the coronavirus.
item.dc:creator: Ji Siqi
item.author: Ji Siqi

item.title: Hong Kong police investigate after TVB’s news app sends out unauthorised push notifications
item.description: Subscribers received 23 push notifications within 21 minutes in early hours of Tuesday, including messages such as ‘Patriots rule Hong Kong’ and ‘yooooooo’.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Ukraine war: Russia shells Mariupol plant with civilians still reported trapped
item.description: Meanwhile, Russian President Vladimir Putin told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron that the West could use its influence to stop ‘atrocities’ in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,Agencies
item.author: Reuters,Agencies

item.title: Hong Kong landowners to get better compensation rates with new mechanism, in bid to boost Northern Metropolis development
item.description: New system offers only two tiers of compensation, to be determined by purpose of land resumption, with rates reviewed every six months.
item.dc:creator: Joyce Ng
item.author: Joyce Ng

item.title: Ukraine war ‘could delay US Stinger missile delivery’ to Taiwan
item.description: Shoulder-launched systems have been in big demand for use against Russian forces.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte vows to ban online cockfighting known as ‘e-sabong’
item.description: There has been outcry over online cockfighting in the Philippines following the disappearance of dozens of workers and concerns about the social costs of gambling.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Covid-19 shows China must rethink its reliance on tight, centralised control to solve every problem
item.description: After China contained the Wuhan outbreak by locking down the city and the rest of the province in 2020, it began to apply the formula to other areas.
item.dc:creator: Josephine Ma
item.author: Josephine Ma

item.title: Chinese doctor travels hundreds of kilometres to save life of newborn baby with breathing difficulties after father’s appeal
item.description: A medical expert and a colleague travel a vast distance to perform a life-saving operation on a sick baby when no other qualified doctors were available due to China’s Covid-19 outbreak.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: ‘Lively and special’: Singapore’s Muslims cheer first Eid without Covid curbing festivities
item.description: The city state’s mosques are once again bustling with worshippers as Eid al-Fitr celebrations return at full scale, after last month’s lifting of capacity limits and social-distancing curbs.
item.dc:creator: Kok Xinghui,Dewey Sim
item.author: Kok Xinghui,Dewey Sim

item.title: Taiwan cuts Covid-19 quarantine for arrivals even as cases rise
item.description: Omicron’s short incubation period and need to maintain pandemic prevention capacity among reasons behind ‘new Taiwan model.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: China yuan: ‘bearish’ offshore weakens to lowest in 17 months as coronavirus lockdowns weigh
item.description: China’s yuan has been tumbling as fears grow about the economic impact of extended lockdowns in many Chinese cities and expectations for US interest rate rises.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Coronavirus: Hong Kong economy shrinks by a worse than expected 4 per cent in first quarter
item.description: Government spokesman says ‘wide range of economic activities’ hit hard by fifth coronavirus wave, anti-epidemic measures.
item.dc:creator: Denise Tsang
item.author: Denise Tsang

item.title: Fiji court rules US can seize Russian superyacht Amadea
item.description: The 350-foot vessel reportedly belonging to sanctioned oligarch Suleiman Kerimov arrived in Fiji last month from Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi charged with bribery as new trial opens
item.description: New case against Suu Kyi alleges she took US$550,000 in bribes from a construction magnate. She is charged with two counts under the the Anti-Corruption Act, with each count punishable by up to 15 years in prison and a fine.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Hong Kong chief executive election 2022: police to mobilise as many as 7,000 officers to ensure ‘event runs smoothly and peacefully’
item.description: Nearly 3,000 officers will be deployed on Hong Kong Island, mostly to guard the election venue in Wan Chai, according to a source.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo,Nadia Lam
item.author: Clifford Lo,Nadia Lam

item.title: Hong Kong’s Exchange Fund posts US$7 billion quarterly loss amid ‘triple whammy’ hit from slumping stocks, bonds and a stronger US dollar
item.description: The Exchange Fund will have to sail through rough seas ahead, as the US Federal Reserve has flagged 10 increase in its benchmark rate through the end of 2023 to tamp down rising inflation in the US economy.
item.dc:creator: Enoch Yiu
item.author: Enoch Yiu

item.title: Helicopter catches falling New Zealand rocket but drops it in the ocean seconds later
item.description: Rocket Lab, the company behind the feat, said the falling Electron rocket booster was grabbed mid-air by a Sikorsky S-92 helicopter.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Hong Kong police arrest 58 over online fraud totalling HK$51 million in losses, with HK$10 million love scam among cases
item.description: HK$10 million love scam involving woman tricked by her online ‘lover’ among cases.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Carrie Lam urges Hong Kong lawmakers to pass overdue labour bill to scrap MPF offsetting mechanism, citing ‘unexpected’ Legco hindrance
item.description: Outgoing chief executive slams hindrance in legislature as ‘unexpected’.
item.dc:creator: Chris Lau,Lilian Cheng
item.author: Chris Lau,Lilian Cheng

item.title: Coronavirus: as Beijing starts rigorous test regime officials name and shame firms breaking Covid-19 rules
item.description: Restaurants allowing dine-in despite a ban and companies not enforcing health codes, masks, temperature scanning and other measures are listed on social media.
item.dc:creator: Holly Chik
item.author: Holly Chik

item.title: The path to Nato membership for Finland and Sweden
item.description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has pushed Finland and Sweden to the verge of applying for Nato membership and abandoning a belief held for decades that peace was best kept by not publicly choosing sides.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 2 more people pulled alive days after building collapses in China
item.description: Woman and man rescued from ruins of structure that caved in in Changsha on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Japan foreign minister to attend South Korean President-elect Yoon’s inauguration to mend frayed ties
item.description: Yoshimasa Hayashi’s presence next week at Yoon Suk Yeol’s oath-taking ceremony a sign of Tokyo’s will to set a new course in relations that had worsened under Moon Jae-in.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: China-reliant Gabon finds oil-free, green future in its forests
item.description: The small African country’s environment minister talks climate financing at the IMF’s spring meeting as the need to replace oil revenues grows.
item.dc:creator: Jevans Nyabiage
item.author: Jevans Nyabiage

item.title: Ukraine war: CIA wants ‘concerned Russians’ to contact it on the darknet
item.description: The CIA is in a new push to promote its presence on a part of the internet accessible only through specialised tools that provide more anonymity.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Australian man jailed for 12 years over 1988 cliff murder of gay American
item.description: Scott White was also awarded a non-parole period of 99 months for the murder of mathematician Scott Johnson three decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Ukraine war: US says Russia’s top general Valery Gerasimov visited Donbas front where Kyiv claimed deadly attack
item.description: The United States believes that the Russian military’s Chief of the General Staff, Valery Gerasimov, visited Ukraine’s Donbas region last week but cannot confirm media reports that he was wounded during fighting.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: Cross-harbour section of Hong Kong’s most expensive rail project to fully open on May 15
item.description: Tests, trial runs for Hung Hom-Admiralty section of Sha Tin-Central rail link completed and ready for launch in mid-May.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau,Denise Tsang
item.author: Cannix Yau,Denise Tsang
